content: अघ {%<ab>a.</ab>%} [अघ्-कर्तरि अच्] Bad, sinful, evil, wicked; अघायुरिंद्रियारामो मोघं पार्थ स जीवति <ls>Bg. 3. 16.</ls> --घं [अघ् भावे अच्] {@--1@} Sin; अघं स केवलं भुंक्ते यः पचत्यात्मकारणात् <ls>Ms. 3. 118</ls>, <ls>Bg. 3. 13</ls>; अघौघविध्वंसविधौ पटीयसींः <ls>Śi. 1. 18</ls>, <ls n="Śi. 1.">26</ls>; °मर्षण &c.; misdeed, fault, crime; श्रेयान् द्विजातिरिव हंतुमघानि दक्षं <ls>Śi. 4. 37</ls> sins and griefs also. {@--2@} An evil, mishap, misfortune, accident, injury, harm; न वधूष्वघानि विमृशंति धियः <ls>Ki. 6. 45</ls> do not think of doing harm or evil; क्रियादघानां मघवा विघातं <ls n="Ki.">3. 52</ls>, <ls n="Ki.">11. 80</ls>; प्रजानां तमघावहं <ls>R. 15. 51</ls>, <ls n="R.">19. 52</ls>, See अनघ. {@--3@} Impurity (अशौचं); अनुरुध्यादघं त्र्यहं <ls>Ms. 5. 63</ls>; न राज्ञामघदोषोस्ति <ls n="Ms. 5.">93</ls>; न वर्धयेदघाहानि <ls n="Ms. 5.">84.</ls> {@--4@} Pain, suffering, grief, distress; दयालुमनघस्पृष्टं <ls>R. 10. 19</ls> not subject to grief. {@--5@} Passion. --घः <ab>N.</ab> of a demon, brother of Baka and Pūtanā and commander-in-chief of Kaṃsa. [Being sent by Kaṃsa to Gokula to kill Kṛṣṇa and Balarāma he assumed the form of a huge serpent {4} yojanas long, and spread himself on the way of the cowherds, keeping his horrid mouth open. The cowherds mistook it for a mountain cavern and entered it, cows and all. But Kṛṣṇa saw it, and having entered the mouth so stretched himself that he tore it to pieces and rescued his companions.] --घा The Goddess of sin; (<ab>pl.</ab>) the constellation usually called Maghā.
